title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the Jazz Age in the United States.

author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

description: A story about teenage alienation and rebellion.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray

description: A story about the portrait of a man that ages while he remains young and beautiful.

description: A whaling adventure and exploration of obsession.

title: The Iliad

description: An epic poem about the Trojan War.

title: Lolita

description: A political allegory that satirizes the Russian Revolution.

title: Brave New World

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem about Odysseus' journey home after the fall of Troy.

title: The Metamorphosis

description: A novella about a man who wakes up to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

author: Franz Kafka

author: Jack London
description: A story of survival and adventure in the Yukon wilderness.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A novel about the moral struggles of a woman condemned to wear a scarlet letter.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel about Russian society during the Napoleonic wars.

author: Charlotte Brontë

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A tale of redemption set against the backdrop of the French Revolution.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A satirical tale of a man who believes himself to be a knight.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel about a woman trapped in a stifling marriage who seeks escape through affairs.

title: Middlemarch
author: George Eliot
description: A novel about the politics, love, and ambitions in a fictional English town.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A coming-of-age story about a young boy’s rise from poverty to wealth.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic novel about a scientist who creates a monstrous life form.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A horror novel about the infamous vampire Count Dracula.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: A modernist novel about time, memory, and family dynamics.

title: Atonement
author: Ian McEwan
description: A story of love, war, and the power of guilt and redemption.

title: The Night Circus

description: A magical competition between two young illusionists unfolds within a mysterious circus.

title: The Underground Railroad

description: A surreal and gripping reimagining of the Underground Railroad as an actual railroad.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing

description: A suburban community is torn apart by tensions between two families.

author: Anthony Doerr
description: The lives of a blind French girl and a German boy intertwine during World War II.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a theocratic society where women are subjugated.

title: Educated

description: The memoir of former First Lady Michelle Obama.

description: A story of love and race, exploring life in Nigeria and the U.S.

author: Liane Moriarty

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: A story of two twin sisters living different lives, one passing as white.

description: A curmudgeonly old man’s life is transformed by the arrival of new neighbors.

title: The Henna Artist
